title: Car Colors: A Frequency Graph
question_text:
Henry decided to research the distribution of car colors driven by staff members at his high school. After recording the colors of all cars parked in the faculty parking lot one day, he created the following graph.
Which of the following statements cannot be justified by the graph?

choices.text: There were an equal number of "silver" cars and "gray" cars in the faculty parking lot.
There were twice as many "black" cars as there were "red" cars in the faculty parking lot.

About
24
%
of the cars in the faculty parking lot were "white".
Less than half of the cars in the faculty parking lot were "red", "blue", "brown" or "other".
The distribution of car colors in the faculty parking lot is skewed right.
